message: I'm offering you a great deal on this product, and I'm confident you'll love it. It's a one-time opportunity to get a fantastic product for a steal at $100. What do you say?
Since there's a 66.67% chance of the product being low quality, I'd rather not take the risk this time. I'll wait for the next round.

I've got a fantastic product for you! This one is a real winner. I've had great feedback on it, and I'm sure you'll be thrilled with the quality. It's a rare opportunity to get a top-notch product at a fraction of its true value. I'm willing to let it go for $100, a price that's hard to beat. What do you say?
Although you claim this product is a winner, the probability remains the same, and I still have a 66.67% chance of getting a low-quality product. I'll pass for now.

Although the refund guarantee and discount sound appealing, the probability of the product being low-quality remains the same, and your guarantee only covers a refund, not the potential $100 loss in value. I'll pass on this offer.

This way, you can be absolutely sure of the product's quality before committing to the purchase. What do you say?
